subject: REC
title: Orient/Leis. & Rec.
info: Opportunities to explore field of recreation/role it plays in society/human development. Visit recreation facilities representing public, quasi-public, for-profit agencies. Overview of recreation field/foundation for continuing on to more advanced recreation courses.

subject: REC
title: Topics in Recreation Admin
info: Topics related to the understanding of the Recreation Industry which may include historical perspectives and philosophical foundations as well as contemporary issues and challenges.

subject: REC
title: Freshman Seminar: Environment
info: Reading, discussion, critical analysis, and writing about environmental issues. Intensive, small-group setting.

subject: REC
title: Freshman Seminar
info: Interdisciplinary seminar. Topics specified in Class Schedule.

subject: REC
title: Outdr & Camp Leadrs
info: Practical/theoretical study of leading/educating diverse groups in outdoor settings. Outdoor leadership skills, styles/methods, how these translate to general leadership methods in other settings/careers. How leadership styles impacts learning processes.

subject: REC
title: Recreation Admin Res/Eval
info: Social research/evaluation methodology. Survey of present status of recreation/park research, evaluation.
prereqInfo: prereq: Rec major or instr consent

subject: REC
title: Recreation Programming
info: Methods, skills, materials needed for planning, developing, implementing, evaluating professional recreation programs for diverse populations in various settings.
prereqInfo: prereq: REC major or instr consent

subject: REC
title: Recreation Admin/Finance
info: Principles/practices of financing/managing leisure service agencies in public/private sector.

subject: REC
title: Leisure & Human Development
info: Explore issues associated with roles of leisure throughout life span. Principles/procedures for designing programs, services, facilities relative to individual values, attitudes, identity, culture, age, gender.
prereqInfo: prereq: REC major or instr consent

subject: REC
title: Senior Internship: Rec Admin
info: On-the-job supervised practical experience under specialist in a field directly related to student's academic program.
prereqInfo: prereq: Rec major, completion of most core courses, sr, instr consent

subject: REC
title: Directed Study: Rec Admin
info: Work with faculty or grad students on research or scholarly or creative activities. Students usually assist with faculty scholarship or carry out projects under faculty supervision. Topic leads to new learning or discovery or contributes to student?s academic program.

subject: REC
title: Rec Land Policy
info: Historical development of recreational land policy in United States. Related contemporary issues in policy, management, interpretation, research.

subject: REC
title: Adventure Recreation, Tourism
info: Development of adventure recreation programs, including  emphasis on tourism industry.

subject: REC
title: Comm Leis/Pers w Disabilities
info: Exploration/application of concepts/techniques of normalization. Least restrictive environment strategies to leisure service delivery in inclusive community settings for range of individuals with disabilities.
prereqInfo: prereq: REC major or instr consent

subject: REC
title: Wilderness and Adventure Educ
info: Rationale for, methods in applying wilderness/adventure education programs in education, recreation, corporate, human service settings. Emphasizes adventure/wilderness program management.

subject: REC
title: Prog Outdr Env Ed
info: Methods, materials, settings for developing/conducting environmental/outdoor education programs.
prereqInfo: prereq: REC major or ORE minor or instr consent

subject: REC
title: Spec Top Cntemp Iss
info: Contemporary issues emphasizing administrative and supervisory functions for recreation and allied professionals; individual offerings, to be determined by faculty, focus on special issues and professional groups.

subject: REC
title: Fnds of Rec
info: Investigation of the rational, sociological, psychological, and philosophical foundations of the recreational use of leisure in contemporary society. Includes a survey of leisure services.

subject: REC
title: Sports Facilities
info: Steps in planning and building facilities for athletics, physical education, and sport for college, professional, and public use.
prereqInfo: prereq: Kin or Rec major or instr consent

subject: REC
title: Event Management in Sport
info: Techniques/principles of planning, funding, and managing sport events. Collegiate championships, non-profit events/benefits, professional events.
prereqInfo: prereq: Credit will not be granted if credit has been received for: : Kin 5115; Grad student, instr consent

subject: REC
title: Intro to TR
info: Purposeful intervention; roles of  specialist/recreation therapists in meeting cognitive, physical, emotional, social needs of people with disabling conditions through recreation services; roles of  specialist/recreation therapists changing societal attitudes toward illness and disability and the self-concepts of individuals with impairments.

subject: REC
title: Assess & Monitor PC Func in RT
info: Selecting appropriate techniques/tools, analysis of individual p/c supports/deficits. Monitoring/recording progress in RT and in collaborative services: standard notes; team meetings; on-line reporting for quality assurance, referral, augmentation/termination of services.

subject: REC
title: Comp TR Svcs/Mgmt
info: Guided development of written plans including development of protocols and critical pathways, intervention programs/activities, individual treatment plans and standards for appropriate placement of individuals in group intervention, and management of patient/client service delivery, record keeping, and administrative responsibilities.

subject: REC
title: Therapeutic Rec & Diagn Grps
info: Definitions, philosophies, methodologies regarding therapeutic recreation services for persons in diagnostic groups of cognitive, physical, sensory, communication, and psychiatric impairments/disabilities. Lectures, group discussion. Presentations by parents, professionals, and self-advocates. Clinical or community practicum assignment.

subject: REC
title: Rec Therapy in Geriatric Care
info: Role of leisure in maintenance of mental, physical, social-emotional health/functioning. Issues relative to prevention of impairment/disability. Rehabilitation, support of vital life involvement, effect on design/delivery of recreation services.

subject: REC
title: Grant Writing
info: Identify, develop, and procure financial assistance for programs in human services, including education, recreation, and social programs. Skills and strategies for preparing and evaluating competitive proposals for grant support through federal agencies and private foundations or corporations.

subject: REC
title: Sport and Society
info: Sport, sporting processes, social influences, systems, and structures that have effected and exist within/among societies, nations, and cultures. Issues concerning social differentiation. Social concerns such as violence and honesty.
prereqInfo: prereq: [3126W, grad student] or instr consent

subject: REC
title: Sport Finance
info: Introduction to financial analysis in sport. Cash flow statements, budgeting issues, traditional/innovative revenue producing strategies available to sport organizations. Discussion, practical analysis of current market.
prereqInfo: prereq: Grad student or instr consent

subject: REC
title: Foundations of Sport Mgmt
info: Theories/techniques in administering/managing sport enterprises. Organizational theory/policy. Practical examples of sport management skills/strategies.
prereqInfo: prereq: Kin or rec or postbac or grad student or instr consent

subject: REC
title: Sport and Gender
info: Critically examines women's involvement in/contributions to sport, physical activity, and leisure.

subject: REC
title: Sport Mgt Ethics and Policy
info: Ethical concepts that underpin or inform sport policies. Evaluating sport policies from a normative point of view. Selected sport policy issues are used to illustrate relevance of ethical considerations in policy development, ethical implications of sport policy.
prereqInfo: prereq: Grad student or instr consent instr consent

subject: REC
title: Programming & Promo in Sport
info: Introduction to marketing concepts as they apply to sport industry. Consumer behavior, market research, marketing mix, corporate sponsorship, licensing concepts. Discussion, practical application.
prereqInfo: prereq: Kin or Rec grad student or instr consent

subject: REC
title: Youth Development Programming
info: Youth development programming for out-of-school time. Philosophy/purpose of youth development programs. Principles/procedures for developing out-of-school time programs.

subject: REC
title: Legal Aspects of Sport/Rec
info: Legal issues related to recreation, park, and sport programs/facilities with public/private sectors.

subject: REC
title: Research Method-Kin,Rec,Sport
info: Defines/reviews various types of research in exercise and sport science, physical education, and recreation studies. Qualitative research, field studies, and introspective research strategies as alternatives to traditional scientific paradigm.
prereqInfo: prereq: MEd or grad student or instr consent

subject: REC
title: Readings: Recreation
info: Independent study under tutorial guidance by faculty member on topic(s) not covered in regular coursework.

subject: REC
title: Problems in Recreation
info: Independent study of leisure service programs, systems, facilities, or policies. Focuses on conduct of recreation programs. Scholarly projects (e.g., library or field research) or demonstration projects.
prereqInfo: prereq: [REC MEd or grad student], instr consent

subject: REC
title: Practicum in Recreation
info: Practical experiences in recreation under supervision of University faculty member and agency supervisor.

subject: REC
title: Seminar: Sport Management
info: Analysis of current literature, theoretical constructs, research methodology, and design relative to sport management. Focuses on student-selected topics, research problems.

subject: REC
title: Sem: Leisure Svcs
info: Critical study and special problems in recreation, park, and leisure services and in therapeutic recreation.

subject: REC
title: Theoretical Perspec
info: Major theoretical paradigms and empirical findings, where appropriate, from leisure studies in particular and social sciences in general.

subject: REC
title: FTE: Master's
info: (No description)

subject: REC
title: Sem Adm Prob LS & TR
info: Administrative and management issues and problems in leisure services and therapeutic recreation.

subject: REC
title: Thesis Credit:Mast*
info: (No description)

subject: REC
title: Grad Res Prob RPLS
info: Analyzing, designing, and reporting on research problems in leisure studies.

subject: REC
title: Research Problems: Recreation
info: Individual scholarly research.
